description:

title: Set up authentication (Passkey + OAuth)
description:
## Task
Implement authentication per PRD Section 8.6.

## Requirements
- Primary: WebAuthn passkeys (device-bound)
- Fallback: Google OAuth for Tanwa/Veerapat
- NO password-based authentication
- Session management per PRD specs

## Session Rules
- Lifetime: 24 hours
- Absolute timeout: 7 days
- Binding: IP + User-Agent hash
- Max concurrent: 3 per user

## Provider Options
- Hanko (recommended)
- Ory
- Custom WebAuthn implementation

## Deliverables
- [ ] Auth provider selected and configured
- [ ] Passkey registration flow
- [ ] OAuth fallback working
- [ ] Session management implemented
- [ ] Tanwa + Veerapat accounts created

title: Implement full-text search for contacts
description:
## Task
Build search functionality using PostgreSQL full-text search.

## Search Scope
- Contact name, aliases, company
- Organization names
- Tags
- Interaction summaries (optional, may be slow)

## Requirements
- Response time <500ms
- Relevance ranking (name > company > alias)
- Filter by entity (user can only search their entities)
- Pagination support

## Implementation
- Use TSVECTOR column (already in schema)
- GIN index for performance
- Ranking with ts_rank()
- Optional: trigram similarity for typo tolerance

## API Endpoints
- GET /search?q=query&entity=tfc&limit=20

## Deliverables
- [ ] Search endpoint implemented
- [ ] Ranking logic tuned
- [ ] Entity filtering enforced
- [ ] Performance verified (<500ms)
- [ ] Edge cases handled (empty, special chars)

title: Build MCP server for Claude integration
description:
## Task
Implement MCP (Model Context Protocol) server per PRD Section 7.1.

## MCP Tools to Expose
1. crm_search_contacts - Full-text and semantic search
2. crm_get_contact - Full contact profile by ID or name
3. crm_list_interactions - Interaction history for contact
4. crm_log_interaction - Create new interaction
5. crm_get_obligations - Get open obligations
6. crm_create_obligation - Log new obligation
7. crm_relationship_digest - Weekly health summary
8. crm_pre_meeting_brief - Generate meeting dossier

## Implementation
- Node.js or Python MCP server
- Connect to existing API (not direct DB)
- Respect user authentication context
- Rate limiting to prevent abuse

## Security (per PRD Section 8.5)
- All queries pass through RLS
- No bulk export capability
- Scoped data retrieval
- MAX_CONTACTS_PER_QUERY = 10
- MAX_INTERACTIONS_PER_CONTACT = 5
- FORBIDDEN_FIELDS = [family_notes, health_info]

## Deliverables
- [ ] MCP server framework set up
- [ ] All 8 tools implemented
- [ ] Auth context passing
- [ ] Rate limiting
- [ ] Error handling
- [ ] Documentation

title: Implement relationship decay alerts
description:
## Task
Build weekly digest of decaying relationships per PRD Section 5.6.

## Decay Rules (from relationships_needing_attention view)
- High priority: strength >= 8, no contact > 30 days
- Medium priority: strength >= 5, no contact > 60 days
- Low priority: any contact, no contact > 90 days

## Digest Contents
- Contacts needing attention (ranked)
- Last interaction date + type
- Suggested action (email, call, coffee)
- Quick action buttons

## Delivery Options
1. Email digest (weekly, configurable day)
2. In-app notification
3. MCP tool (crm_relationship_digest)

## User Preferences
- Frequency: daily/weekly/monthly
- Priority threshold: high_only / medium+ / all
- Entity filter: which entities to include

## Deliverables
- [ ] Decay calculation logic
- [ ] Weekly digest email
- [ ] In-app alerts
- [ ] MCP tool integration
- [ ] User preferences

title: Implement semantic search with pgvector

- full_name, preferred_name
- current_title, current_company
- origin_context
- expertise_areas
- interests

## Search Function
semantic_contact_search(query_embedding, limit) returns:
- id, full_name, similarity score

## Embedding Generation
- Option 1: OpenAI text-embedding-3-small
- Option 2: Claude embeddings (if available)
- Option 3: Local model (Sentence Transformers)

title: Backup and recovery testing
description:
## Task
Verify backup/restore procedures per PRD Section 8.8.

## Backup Requirements
- Frequency: Daily full, hourly incremental
- Encryption: AES-256 with separate key
- Storage: Different cloud region from primary
- Retention: 90 days daily, 2 years monthly

## Testing Procedure
1. Take current backup
2. Provision clean database
3. Restore from backup
4. Verify data integrity
5. Test application connectivity
6. Document recovery time

## Monthly Cadence
- Schedule monthly restore tests
- Document results
- Alert on failures

## Deliverables

- [ ] Encryption verified
- [ ] First restore test completed
